ygData.subject: Re: URI Canonicalization Rules problem
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Noah, I can verify that all rules are now logged. Now I just have the problem that my sheet will not be used for my domain. when I copy the RegexRule bean

X-Yahoo-Profile: mirschi74

Hi Noah,

I can verify that all rules are now logged.

Now I just have the =
problem that my sheet will not be used for my domain.
when I copy the Regex=
Rule bean directly into the canonicalizationPolicy it works.
But when I wan=
t to use the alternative canonicalization policy which merges the two polic=
ies it is ignored.
Its always using the standard policy.
Not sure why this =
happens.
I have the SurtPrefixesSheetAssociation and I assign the right she=
et to the domain but the overlay does not happen.

I dont know what else ca=
n be the reason to ignore the Sheet association aside a wrong SurtPrefix.
I=
 have uncommented the SheetOverlaysManager bean too.


Thanks and regards,
=
Markus



--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...>=
 wrote:
>
> Hello Markus,
> 
> There was another bug in the wiki page. This=
 line should work in logging.properties:
> 
> org.archive.modules.canonical=
ize.RulesCanonicalizationPolicy.level =3D FINER
> 
> I've updated the page.=

> 
> Can you verify with that logging enabled that your rules are not bein=
g applied?
> 
> Noah
> 
> 
> On 2011-08-31 11:57 , mirschi74 wrote:
> > Hel=
lo Noah,
> >
> > thanks for the quick response. With your fix I was able to=
 build the job and keep testing.
> > But there is another problem now.
> > =
To me it looks like all Canonicalization Rules are ignored, not only my reg=
ex rule.
> > I was implementing it exactly like the documentation of the UR=
I Canonicalization Rules describe it.
> > Because my Regex was ignored I tu=
rned on the logging for the canonicalization in logging.properties like des=
cribed in the documentation but no entries in the log file.
> > Shouldnt I =
see there entries for all enabled Canonicalization rules like the LowercasR=
ule, StripWWWNRule and so on.
> > But there is nothing to see.
> > And shou=
ldnt I see at least the result of the basic canonicalizationPolicy rules li=
ke the LowercaseRule when I look in the crawl log (everything should be low=
ercase there)?
> >
> > But maybe I just understand the effect of these rule=
s wrong ;-)
> >
> > Thanks in advance,
> > Markus
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > --- I=
n archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Noah Levitt<nlevitt@>  wrote:
> >>
> >> =
Hello Markus,
> >>
> >> Thanks for this report, you've brought to light a b=
ug in the code and a
> >> mistake in the documentation which conspired to p=
roduce this obtuse error.
> >>
> >> First problem is the exception you got:=

> >>
> >> java.lang.IllegalStateException: Can't overwrite cause
> >> 	at =
java.lang.Throwable.initCause(Throwable.java:320)
> >> 	at org.archive.spri=
ng.Sheet.prime(Sheet.java:152)
> >>
> >> It was thrown in the process of ha=
ndling the real exception, preventing
> >> the real stack trace from making=
 it into the log. I've checked in a fix
> >> for that - https://webarchive.=
jira.com/source/changelog/HER?cs=3D7235
> >>
> >> With that change in place=
, the real problem is revealed:
> >>
> >> 2011-08-30T22:56:24.688Z SEVERE F=
ailed to convert property value of type
> >> 'java.lang.String' to required=
 type
> >> 'org.archive.modules.canonicalize.UriCanonicalizationPolicy' for=

> >> property 'canonicalizationPolicy';
> >>
> >> As you mentioned, you we=
re using this snippet as recommended by the wiki
> >> page:
> >>
> >> <entr=
y key=3D'preparer.canonicalizationPolicy'
> >> value=3D'altCanonicalization=
Policy'/>  <!-- wrong -->
> >>
> >> But instead it should look like this:
>=
 >>
> >> <entry key=3D'preparer.canonicalizationPolicy'>
> >> <ref bean=3D'=
altCanonicalizationPolicy'/>
> >> </entry>
> >>
> >> I've fixed the doc.
> =
>> https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/URI+Canonicalization+R=
ules
> >>
> >> Noah
> >>
> >>
> >>
> >> On 08/30/2011 12:28 PM, mirschi74 w=
rote:

rix/URI+Canonicalization+Rules

tion the IllegalStateException I copied below will be thrown as soon as I t=
ry to build my job.
> >>>
> >>> The exception will be thrown when this line=
 appears in the canonicalizationPolicySheet bean:
> >>> <entry key=3D'prepa=
rer.canonicalizationPolicy' value=3D'altCanonicalizationPolicy'/>
> >>>
> >=
>> It seems like it doesnt matter what i write inside the altcaonicalizatio=
nPolicy bean. Just the fact that I try to use it throws an exception.
> >>>=

> >>> Does anyone have an idea what might be the problem? Im searching two=
 days now but cant find anything.
> >>>
> >>> Thanks in advance,
> >>> Mark=
us
